summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, dated November 24, 2021. It announces the production of additional witness materials, including Jencks Act and Giglio material for potential trial witnesses, and certain materials for individuals not currently intended to be called. The letter details the confidential designation of the materials under the existing protective order.

events.title: Production of Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces additional Jencks Act, Giglio, and other witness-related materials to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the confidentiality of materials like those produced in this letter.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced additional witness materials, including Jencks Act and Giglio material, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on November 24, 2021.
The production included materials for both witnesses the government may call and individuals it does not currently intend to call, the latter provided as a courtesy.
All produced materials are governed by a confidential protective order dated July 31, 2020, and are marked accordingly to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The letter explicitly states the government reserves the right to call individuals listed in the 'non-witness' index at a later date.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams, indicating high-level oversight of the case materials production.
